SEARCH
Package HumanObject

Class BasePerson

java.lang.Object
HumanObject.BasePerson
Direct Known Subclasses:
Administrator, Doctor, Patient, Pharmacist
public class BasePerson extends Object
The BasePerson class represents a basic person entity with attributes such as ID, name, date of birth (DOB), gender, and role. It provides methods for accessing and modifying these attributes, as well as generating a formatted ID string based on the role.

      The name of the person.

    • DOB

      protected Date DOB
      The date of birth of the person.

    • gender

      protected Boolean gender
      The gender of the person. True represents male, and False represents female.

    • role

      protected ROLE role
      The role of the person, represented by the ROLE enum.

  • Constructor Details

    • BasePerson

      public BasePerson()
      Default constructor that initializes a BasePerson object by prompting the user for input values such as name, date of birth, and gender. The gender is determined based on user input ('m' for male, 'f' for female).

    • BasePerson

      public BasePerson(int ID, String Name, Date DOB, Boolean Gender)
      Constructs a BasePerson object with the specified ID, name, date of birth, and gender.
      Parameters:
      ID - The unique identifier for the person.
      Name - The name of the person.
      DOB - The date of birth of the person.
      Gender - The gender of the person. True for male, False for female.

    • getGender

      public Boolean getGender()
      Returns the gender of the person.
      Returns:
      True if the person is male, False if the person is female.

    • getRole

    • setGender

      Parameters:
      gender - The new gender of the person. True for male, False for female.

    • getStrID

      public String getStrID()
      Generates and returns a formatted string representation of the person's ID. The string is constructed using a prefix based on the role, followed by zero-padding to match the required length of IDLength (6 characters).
      Returns:
      The formatted string representation of the ID.
